question.body: Which of the following is an ordinal scale of measurement?

response.feedback: Correct. This measure, like all ordinal scale of measurements, rank-orders participants on some scale or attribute. Thus, the condition of a car is ranked, but the distance between the ranks is unknown.
Incorrect. Remember the ordinal scale of measurement is used to rank-order participants on some scale or attribute; it does not, however, convey differences between participants.
